notes: Second generation A3 (8P, 2003–2013). First A3 generation sold in US. quattro AWD available on 3.2L models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A3 article, January 2025 revision.
Sixth generation A4 (B6, 2000–2004). Available multitronic CVT on FWD models. quattro AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A4 article, January 2025 revision.
Seventh generation A4 (B7, 2004–2008). Mid-cycle refresh of B6. quattro AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A4 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation A5 (8T, 2007–2016). New coupe model based on B7 platform. quattro AWD standard in US. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A5 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation A6 (C6, 2004–2011). Available multitronic CVT on FWD models. quattro AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A6 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation A8 (D3, 2002–2010). Aluminum Space Frame construction. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A8 article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation TT (8J, 2006–2014). quattro AWD available on 3.2L models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi TT article, January 2025 revision.

First generation R8 (42, 2006–2015). Mid-engine supercar. Naturally aspirated V8. quattro AWD standard. Aluminum Space Frame construction. Requires specialized service access for mid-engine layout. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi R8 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation Q7 (4L, 2005–2015). First Audi SUV. Three-row seating. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi Q7 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation Q5 (8R, 2008–2017). Built on B8 platform. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi Q5 article, January 2025 revision.
Sixth generation S4 (B6, 2003–2005). Performance variant of A4. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S4 article, January 2025 revision.
Seventh generation S4 (B7, 2005–2008). Performance variant of A4. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S4 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation S5 (8T, 2007–2016). Performance variant of A5. Naturally aspirated V8. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S5 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation S6 (C6, 2006–2011). Performance variant of A6. Lamborghini-derived V10 engine. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S6 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation S8 (D3, 2006–2009). Performance variant of A8. Lamborghini-derived V10 engine. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S8 article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation TTS (8J, 2008–2014). Performance variant of TT. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi TT article, January 2025 revision.

First generation R8 V10 (42, 2009–2015). Mid-engine supercar. Lamborghini-derived V10 engine. quattro AWD standard. Requires specialized service access for mid-engine layout. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi R8 article, January 2025 revision.

First generation Allroad (C5, 1999–2005). Raised A6 Avant with adaptive air suspension. Air suspension requires specialized service. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi Allroad article, January 2025 revision.
Seventh generation RS4 (B7, 2006–2008). High-performance variant of A4. Naturally aspirated V8. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi RS4 article, January 2025 revision.
